Directives: submit-button

submit-button

submit-button(class, disable, icon, label)

Displays a submit <button> component that is automatically disabled when a form is invalid or in the process of submitting.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
class String

Optional CSS class names to apply to button component.
disable Boolean

Disable button. (Note the name is disable and not disabled to avoid collisions with the HTML5 disabled attribute).
icon String

Optional CSS class to display as a button icon.
label String

Button label. HTML is allowed for this attribute.
Source:
  • directives/submit-button.js, line 1
Example
// Here is a simple submit button with an icon:
<submit-button label="Sign Up" icon="fa fa-user"></submit-button>

// You can use your own <button> components within a formFor as well.
// If you choose to, it is recommended that you bind your buttons disabled attribute to a disabledByForm scope property (managed by formFor) as follows:
<form form-for="formData">
  <button ng-disabled="disabledByForm">Submit</button>
</form>
